Do you know how to enter the grub prompt during boot?

OK, so go into the grub prompt before it starts booting. There it gives some options to edit the boot parameters. Find the default one, and add to the options:  notls noacpi    then boot with those options. If it works, put those options into the file /boot/grub/menu.lst
With dual-core cpus the notls is to make sure one cpu doesn't race, it gets stuck at 100% while the other is not used sometimes.
